channel.title: [PI] How to Add PNPC Command?
channel.description: Is it possible to add a command to a PI server that turns you into an npc? For example, some servers have a command ::pnpc (id) that transforms you into whatever the npc is. I tried copying a command from one server's Command.java to my Command.java, but it didn't work. I'm mainly asking if anyone knows how to add a command to a PI server that transforms you into an npc.

item.title: [PI] How to Add PNPC Command?
item.dc:creator: @adamknightz adamknightz
item.description:
@adamknightz wrote:

Woopzpkedu:

u prob mising a ) or ( make sure it didnt join other code bits

That’s not the reason…it’s still not working. 100 errors, no matter where I put it. Is it suppose to be under a certain place in Player.java?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] How to Add PNPC Command?
item.dc:creator: @adamknightz adamknightz
item.description:
@adamknightz wrote:

I get 100 errors when I try to compile after adding

                        if (isNpc == false) {
                        if (playerEquipment[playerHat] > 1) {
                                playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerHat]);
                        } else {
                                playerProps.writeByte(0);
                        }

item.title: [PI] How to Add PNPC Command?
item.dc:creator: @adamknightz adamknightz
item.description:
@adamknightz wrote:

[quote=“Woopzpkedu, post:4, topic:381406”]go to player.java and add this public boolean isNpc; then add this somewhere if (isNpc == false) { if (playerEquipment[playerHat] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerHat]); } else { playerProps.writeByte(0); } [/quote]

Where do I add

                        if (isNpc == false) {
                        if (playerEquipment[playerHat] > 1) {
                                playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerHat]);
                        } else {
                                playerProps.writeByte(0);
                        }

??

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] How to Add PNPC Command?
item.dc:creator: @adamknightz adamknightz
item.description:
@adamknightz wrote:

[quote=“Woopzpkedu, post:2, topic:381406”] if (playerCommand.startsWith("pnpc")) { try { int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.substring(5)); if (newNPC <= 200000 && newNPC >= 0) { c.npcId2 = newNPC; c.isNpc = true; c.updateRequired = true; c.setAppearanceUpdateRequired(true); } else { c.sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } } [/quote]

When I do that and compile, I get 2 errors:

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:379: cannot find symbol symbol : variable npcId2 Location: class server.model.players.Client c.npcId2 = newNPC; ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:380: cannot find symbol symbol : variable isNpc location: class server.mode.lplayers.Client c.isNpc = true; ^ Note: Some Input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

And when I log in, the command doesn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] How to Add PNPC Command?
item.dc:creator: @Woopzpkedu Woopzpkedu
item.description:
@Woopzpkedu wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("pnpc")) { try { int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.substring(5)); if (newNPC <= 200000 && newNPC >= 0) { c.npcId2 = newNPC; c.isNpc = true; c.updateRequired = true; c.setAppearanceUpdateRequired(true); } else { c.sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } }

Read full topic
